page.title: 18Landscape and Manscape
page.content: Many things in the village of Colerne have changed during the last 900 years. There used to be a lot more woodland and fields which have now been taken over by housing estates. But there are still many things which remain how they were 900 years ago, which include some of the hedgerow, streams and rivers, footpaths and badger sets. The eastern part of our area has been declared a place of natural beauty so any future building will be limited by the council. Colerne Park has recently been protected by the Wildlife Fund, a few years ago it used to be private but now is open to the public. The landscape is constantly being changed by man, as this survey is being compiled a few fields are being dug up for a water-pipeline.
